titleStmt.title: Letter from Lambert Tree to Edmund Van Eetvelde, Administrator General of Foreign Affairs, April 13, 1887

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Lambert Tree to Edmund Van Eetvelde, Administrator General of Foreign Affairs

msIdentifier.repository: Ministère des Affaires étrangères, Brussels, Belgium

div1.p: Legation of the United States of America.
I understand that a Treaty has just been entered into between Mr. Henry M. Stanley on behalf of the Independent State of the Congo, and Tippoo Tib Vali of the district of Stanley Falls.

May I venture to ask you for a copy of this Treaty if it has been published, and also for some account of exactly who Tippoo Tib is, what he represents, and what his power is in the country and how dirived. I desire the information in order to communicate it to my Government as part of the history of the interesting current events, concerning the new State of the Congo.
In thanking you in advance, I avail myself equally of the opportunity to renew to your the assurance of my most distinguished consideration.

To Mr. Edmund Van Eetvelde
Administrator General of Foreign Affairs
